For example if youâ€™re wearing heavy armor with a constitution perk, youâ€™re more likely to receive more heavy armor with a constitution perk. 

Loot biasing only takes into account your <font color="#edc63e">currently equipped gear</font> and is stronger at higher levels. Itâ€™s intended to help you find gear thatâ€™s more effective for your preferred build. 

There is always a chance for loot biasing to impact your rewards when loot is dropped, and the chance is increased or even guaranteed for some activities such as Mutators and Outpost Rush.

There are five attributes you can assign points to in the Character screen that can improve your weapons or increase your health. Each weapon has a primary attribute, and some weapons have a secondary attribute. Assign points to their primary and secondary attributes to increase their damage or healing effectiveness. Earn additional bonuses at various thresholds of each attribute. Hover over next to each attribute in the character screen to learn more. You can respec attributes for free until level 60. PRIMARY ATTRIBUTES Every weapon has a primary attribute. A primary attribute will have the most impact on the weaponâ€™s damage scaling. SECONDARY ATTRIBUTES Many weapons have a secondary attribute that increases weapon damage at a reduced scale compared to its primary attribute. For example, the primary attribute for the Spear is Dexterity which scales its damage by 90%. The secondary attribute for the Spear is Strength which scales its damage by 65%. Discover primary and secondary attributes by hovering over the information icon next to each Attribute in the Character Screen. FOCUS AND HEALING Healing is exclusively scaled by Focus. For example, if you use a Void Gauntlet and only apply attributes in its primary attribute, Intelligence, you will miss out increased Healing effects you could receive from applying attributes in Focus. ATTRIBUTE THRESHOLD BONUSES Each attribute has bonuses that are activated by raising the attribute to a threshold. Hover over the circles in each attributeâ€™s progress bar to learn more.
Take advantage of enemy weaknesses to types of damage.

DAMAGE TYPES Each weapon has a default damage type. Some attacks and abilities will use a different type than the weapon's default. Certain gems can be used to convert a portion of the damage to a different type. â€¢ Slash â€¢ Thrust â€¢ Strike â€¢ Fire: Conversion gem: Ruby â€¢ Ice: Conversion gem: Aquamarine â€¢ Lightning: Conversion gem: Topaz â€¢ Nature: Conversion gem: Amber â€¢ Void: Conversion gem: Amethyst â€¢ Arcane: Conversion gem: Sapphire When you hit something with an attack or ability, a number will fly out showing the amount of damage with the damage type icon next to it. When targets are weak or resistant to a damage type, you will do more or less damage in these cases and the number will be a different color. ENEMIES Each type of enemy has one or more weaknesses to different damage types and are grouped into one of these categories. â€¢ Corrupted: Corrupted creatures and structures are dark and glowing red. Weakness - Thrust, Arcane, and Nature damage. â€¢ Lost: The Lost are soulless phantoms and shambling corpses. Weakness - Strike, Ice, and Nature damage. â€¢ Beast: Animals large and small. Weakness - Thrust. â€¢ Ancient: Living skeletons from an ancient civilization. Weakness - Strike, Lightning, and Void damage. â€¢ Angry Earth: Nature that has taken humanoid, animal, and monstrous forms. Weakness - Slash and Fire damage. â€¢ Human:Weakness - Slash damage.
Equip <font color="#edc63e">Heartrunes</font> to gain new abilities.

Heartrunes grant special abilities that can be used separately from weapon abilities. 

<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Pica_Regular.font" color="#c6b694" >EQUIPPING HEARTRUNES</font> 
The Heartrune equipment slot can be unlocked by completing the quest <font color="#edc63e">â€œSecrets of the Heartgemâ€</font> in Brimstone Sands. 

After the slot is unlocked, Heartrunes can be equipped and swapped out similar to other equipment. Only one Heartrune can be equipped at a time. 

<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Pica_Regular.font" color="#c6b694" >USING HEARTRUNES</font> 
Once a Heartrune is equipped, the Heartrune meter with the same icon as your equipped Heartrune, will be present near your other abilities on the HUD. 

Engaging in combat will fill the <font color="#edc63e">meter</font>, and once it is full, you will be able to activate the equipped Heartrune ability by pressing {$player.rune_ability$}. The meter will need to be filled again after it's used. 

<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Pica_Regular.font" color="#c6b694" >FINDING AND UPGRADING HEARTRUNES</font> 
Heartrunes can be crafted in a <font color="#edc63e">Gypsum Kiln</font> using materia and can drop from specific enemies in expeditions and raids. 

When a Heartrune is first obtained, it will be a minor version of the Heartrune. Heartrunes can be upgraded at the Gypsum Kiln.
Loot <font color="#edc63e">Elite Chests</font> once a day for valuable rewards.

Elite Chests contain powerful rewards but can only be looted once a day. Elite Chests can be found in <font color="#edc63e">Elite Areas</font> that are intended for 5+ players, such as Myrkgard in Shattered Mountain, and other various corners of Aeternum. Some Elite Chests, such as those in Brimstone Sands and Elysian Wilds, require special glyphs or signets to open.\n\nCheck the Recruitment channel for player-organized <font color="#edc63e">Elite Chest Runs</font>.
Collect <font color="#edc63e">Ancient Glyphs</font> to unlock Elite Chests and more in Brimstone Sands.\n\nLearn about Ancient Glyphs in the Journal.

Unlock Ancient Glyphs throughout <font color="#edc63e">Brimstone Sands</font>. Once you have unlocked an Ancient Glyph, you can unlock Elite Chests, passageways to difficult enemies, and other secret parts of Aeternum that feature the same Glyph. See your unlocked Ancient Glyphs in the <font color="#edc63e">Documents</font> tab of the <font color="#edc63e">Journal</font>.
Collect <font color="#edc63e">Beast Signets</font> to unlock Elite Chests and more in Elysian Wilds.

Unlock <font color="#edc63e">Beast Signets</font> throughout <font color="#edc63e">Elysian Wilds</font>. Once you have unlocked a Beast Signet, you can unlock Elite Chests, pathways to new areas, and other secret parts of Aeternum that feature the same signet. See your unlocked Beast Signets in the <font color="#edc63e">Documents</font> tab of the <font color="#edc63e">Journal</font>.
You've accomplished much, but your adventure is far from over.\n\nLearn about <font color="#edc63e">End Game Activities</font> in the Journal.

Now that you've reached maximum level, continue your path as a <font color="#edc63e">Soulwarden</font>.

<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Pica_Regular.font" color="#c6b694" >POWER</font>
Seek Power in <font color="#edc63e">Mutated Expeditions</font>, <font color="#edc63e">Elite Chest Runs</font>, and <font color="#edc63e">Elite Trials</font> where you work with others to defeat strong foes and gain powerful gear in return.

<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Pica_Regular.font" color="#c6b694" >RICHES</font>
Earn <font color="#edc63e">Coin</font> through advanced crafting, refining, and resource gathering.

<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Pica_Regular.font" color="#c6b694" >FAME</font>
Find Fame in Aeternum by taking over <font color="#edc63e">territories</font> with your company or ranking among the elite in <font color="#edc63e">Leaderboards</font>.
Use a <font color="#edc63e">Fast Travel Shrine</font> to teleport to settlements and other shrines.

Fast Travel Shrines allow you to <font color="#edc63e">teleport</font> to settlements and other shrines. They are also considered <font color="#edc63e">Sanctuaries</font> where you can flag for PvP (Player Versus Player) once you've joined a faction.
{$movement.prone_toggle_pad$} <font color="#edc63e">Prone</font> and <font color="#edc63e">move forward</font> to crawl.
{$movement.prone_toggle$} <font color="#edc63e">Prone</font> and <font color="#edc63e">move forward</font> to crawl.

Use <font color="#edc63e">Prone</font> and move forward to crawl through tight spaces or hide from enemies. Being prone also has the additional advantage of causing your <font color="#edc63e">Nameplate to disappear</font> from the view of other Players. While it takes a moment to stand up, you can use tactic to ambush PvP opponents in areas with lots of bushes or debris.
When your attack is <font color="#edc63e">blocked</font> by an enemy, use <font color="#edc63e">heavy attacks</font> to reduce their stamina.\n\nHold {$player.attack_primary_hold$} to Heavy Attack.

Enemies can <font color="#edc63e">block</font> your attacks as long as they have stamina. While all attacks reduce stamina, <font color="#edc63e">heavy attacks</font> will reduce an enemy's stamina faster and break their blocks.
<font color="#edc63e">Join one of 3 Factions</font> in Everfall to <font color="#edc63e">PvP</font>, join a <font color="#edc63e">Company</font>, and more.

Join a faction by completing a Faction questline. Choose between <font color="#edc63e">Marauders</font>, <font color="#edc63e">Covenant</font>, and <font color="#edc63e">Syndicate</font>. Once you join a faction, you can join a company within that faction, visit the faction's vendor to receive missions and make purchases, or flag for PvP (Player-versus-Player) and fight other factions.
Enemies or items required for your quests will show a <font color="#edc63e">marker</font> above them.
When enemies or objects are associated with a quest, they will show a <font color="#edc63e">marker</font> above them so you can distinguish what is essential from the rest of the world.
<font color="#edc63e">Hover</font> over each <font color="#edc63e">weapon</font> and use {$ui_inventory_actions.inventoryUse$} to <font color="#edc63e">equip</font> them.
<font color="#edc63e">Hover</font> over each <font color="#edc63e">weapon</font> and <font color="#edc63e">double click LMB</font> to <font color="#edc63e">equip</font> them.

Customize your character's Weapons and Armors by accessing Changing Skins and Dying Items through the Options button. \n \nYou can also access Augments to use XP Boosters and Permits.

Aeternum has a <font color="#edc63e">Storage Shed</font> in each settlement and outpost. 

<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Pica_Regular.font" color="#c6b694" >ACCESS</font> 
Access your Storage Sheds in other territories using the drop-down menu. 

<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Pica_Regular.font" color="#c6b694" >SORTING</font> 
Sort items in storage by Weight, Gear Score, Tier, and Time. 

<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Pica_Regular.font" color="#c6b694" >WEIGHT LIMITS</font> 
Increase the weight limit of each storage shed by choosing the Storage Bonus when you raise Territory Standing or by placing storage furniture in your house.

<font color="#edc63e">Storage Sheds</font> provide access to items you've stored at <font color="#edc63e">any</font> settlement.\n\n<font color="#edc63e">Use the drop down</font> to change which settlement to store/take items from.

Aeternum's dynamic economy revolves around the <font color="#edc63e">Trading Post</font>. This is your hub for buying and selling items, resources, and other goods in order to make coin.

<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Pica_Regular.font" color="#c6b694" >SEARCH AND FILTER </font> 
 â€¢ Use the search bar to find specific items 
 â€¢ Apply filter and sorting preferences 
 â€¢ Select for usability and/or affordability 
 â€¢ Hover over any item to see more details 
 
<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Pica_Regular.font" color="#c6b694" >PLACE BUY ORDER </font> 
 â€¢ Declare that you will purchase a specific item for a set price 
 â€¢ Define quantity, listing duration, gear score, and more 
 
<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Pica_Regular.font" color="#c6b694" >CONFIRM PURCHASE </font> 
 â€¢ Purchased items can be found in your storage

<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Pica_Regular.font" color="#c6b694" >DISCOUNTS </font> 
 â€¢ All Buy and Sell Orders on the trading post have a listing fee 
 â€¢ This fee can be discounted with Territory Standing bonuses earned for that trading post's territory 
 â€¢ Further discounts await if your company governs the territory! 
 
<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Pica_Regular.font" color="#c6b694" >MARKET RESEARCH </font> 
 â€¢ The Trading Post can be a fount of wealth if used correctly 
 â€¢ Keep an eye on the cost and desirability of items in the current market 
 â€¢ Setting competitive prices increases your chances of a successful transaction

<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Pica_Regular.font" color="#c6b694" >LIST ITEMS FOR SALE </font> 
 â€¢ Select the item to sell in the sell tab, only tradeable items will be shown 
 â€¢ Choose whether to place a sell order or fulfill a buy order listed underneath 
 â€¢ Set a price, quantity, and listing duration 
 
<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Pica_Regular.font" color="#c6b694" >MANAGE AND MONITOR </font> 
 â€¢ Check the order's status under 'My Orders' 
 â€¢ You'll receive a notification when the order's status changes

<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Pica_Regular.font" color="#c6b694" >FULFILL BUY ORDERS </font> 
 â€¢ The 'All Items' tab displays all buy orders from other players 
 â€¢ You can filter Buy Orders by perks, attributes, and gear score to find your specific item 
 â€¢ You can also use the Trade chat channel to call out items that you are willing to buy or sell 
 
<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Pica_Regular.font" color="#c6b694" >SET COMPETITIVE PRICES </font> 
 â€¢ Adjust your price based on market trends of the same or similar items 
 â€¢ Reference the current market prices of the item by selecting the item to see current buy orders or searching for it in the 'All Items' tab

<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Pica_Regular.font" color="#c6b694" >ACTIVE ORDERS </font> 
 â€¢ Monitor currently active Buy and Sell Orders 
 â€¢ Cancel unwanted items or orders by selecting the listing 
 â€¢ Check the details of your open orders here 
 
<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Pica_Regular.font" color="#c6b694" >COMPLETED AND EXPIRED ORDERS </font> 
 â€¢ Review past transactions both completed and expired 
 â€¢ Items from expired or cancelled orders are returned to your storage

Entering a <font color="#edc63e">Seasonal World</font>.\n\nCraft and battle for <font color="#edc63e">Conqueror's Gear</font> - never before seen weapons and armor. Get ready, you will <font color="#edc63e">automatically flag for PvP</font> at Level {^u|javelin.pvp-always-on-min-level^}.

Aeternum has revealed a powerful new resource called <font color="#edc63e">Wrathstone</font>, leading to a battle between Factions over this resource and the formidable Conqueror's Gear that can be crafted from it. <font color="#edc63e">Welcome to Season 7's Seasonal World</font>. 

This is a Player versus Player World (PvP) where you <font color="#edc63e">automatically flag for PvP at level {^u|javelin.pvp-always-on-min-level^}</font>. 

<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Pica_Regular.font" color="#c6b694" >CONQUEROR'S GEAR</font> 
<font color="#edc63e">Gather Wrathstone by wearing craftable Ethereal Gear</font> while gathering resources, doing corrupted portals and in Elite Areas. Use Wrathstone to craft extremely powerful <font color="#edc63e">Conqueror's Gear</font> for the battlefield. 

Salvage Conqueror and Ethereal items or refine basic materials such as ore, wood, stone, fiber and hides into <font color="#edc63e">Ethereal Dust</font> which can be further refined into <font color="#edc63e">Ethereal Expertise Animus</font>. These items can be consumed to gain experience and a chance to earn crafting patterns for Conqueror's Gear as well as other items to speed up your progress. Craft your first mount with Ethereal Dust at any camp and is usable at level 15. 

Ethereal, Conqueror's Gear and Wrathstones <font color="#edc63e">drop on death</font> in the open world and can be gathered by other players. Ethereal and Conqueror's Gear have <font color="#edc63e">durability</font> and cannot be repaired. 

<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Pica_Regular.font" color="#c6b694" >REWARDS AND SEASON END</font> 
Earn unique skins, titles, and rewards from the <font color="#edc63e">Season Journey</font> and leaderboards. 

At the end of the season, you can <font color="#edc63e">transfer your character to another world</font>, keeping progression and rewards such as skins and titles that you've earned. Ethereal and Conqueror's gear will be converted into alternative gear available on standard worlds. The leaderboard season ends early in this world. Ensure to log in before world closes for good to claim leaderboard rewards.

<font color="#edc63e">Equip Ethereal Gear</font> to obtain <font color="#edc63e">Wrathstone</font> from gathering resources, Elite areas and Corrupted Portals. \n\nCareful, Ethereal gear drops on death.

<font color="#edc63e">Equip Ethereal Gear to acquire Wrathstone</font> from gathering resources, Elite areas, and Corrupted Portals. Use Wrathstone to <font color="#edc63e">craft Conqueror's Gear</font> - gear with powerful perks only found in Seasonal Worlds.

Ethereal Gear can be crafted at various crafting stations. Alternatively, acquire Ethereal Gear from other players as it <font color="#edc63e">drops on death</font>. 

<font color="#edc63e">Ethereal Gear has durability</font> and cannot be repaired. You can store Ethereal Gear in your gear set storage, but it will not protect your gear from dropping on death.

In all instanced activities, such as 3v3 Arenas, Outpost Rush, expeditions, and Invasions, Ethereal Gear perks are disabled and will not drop on death.
You've acquired a piece of powerful <font color="#edc63e">Conqueror's Gear</font>! \n\nDiscover its unique perk in the item's tooltip.

<font color="#edc63e">Conqueror's Gear</font> changes the Player versus Player landscape. They feature unique, powerful perks only found on Seasonal Worlds. 

Craft Conqueror's Gear at various crafting stations using Wrathstone. Wrathstone is obtainable when wearing Ethereal Gear. Alternatively, acquire Conqueror's Gear from other players as it <font color="#edc63e">drops on death</font>. 

<font color="#edc63e">Conqueror's Gear has durability</font> and cannot be repaired. You can store Conqueror's Gear in your gear set storage, but it will not protect your gear from dropping on death.

In all instanced activities, such as 3v3 Arenas, Outpost Rush, expeditions, and Invasions, Conqueror's Gear perks are disabled and will not drop on death.
Reminder: You will <font color="#edc63e">permanently flag for PvP at level {^u|javelin.pvp-always-on-min-level^}</font>.
You are now <font color="#edc63e">permanently flagged for PvP</font> on this world. Good luck!
